text:
Hi 
You can define how the updates are being pushed using MS Teams policy. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/new-teams-deploy-using-policies?tabs=teams-admin-center
 
You could have 2 policies: 
Default: Use of the new client is blocked for everybody. 
Early adopters: Use of some new functions, like the new MS Teams Client, is
allowed (ie. User Decides). Put your pilot/test users there. 
But, this sucks. MS decided to install the client in appdata, so centrally
updating all users on a PC is, well, potentially a mess. I "love" when the
client is uninstalled (from appdata), tries to install the new one, but the user
lacks permissions and finishes with no MS Teams installed on his profile. 
Best regards 
Seve 
Von: 'Amag' via PatchManagement <

metadata.topic: Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
metadata.subject: AW: [patchmanagement] Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from juan.severino@skan.ch. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hi 
You can define how the updates are being pushed using MS Teams policy. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/new-teams-deploy-using-policies?tabs=teams-admin-center
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoftteams%2Fnew-teams-deploy-using-policies%3Ftabs%3Dteams-admin-center&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C95bcb94826a0454002e608dc15a458b6%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638409042813097472%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qiTNsSnXjCz8YbCSioMO7HMSWS5LVf1%2BYUsGdpWabCo%3D&reserved=0] 
You could have 2 policies: 
Default: Use of the new client is blocked for everybody. 
Early adopters: Use of some new functions, like the new MS Teams Client, is
allowed (ie. User Decides). Put your pilot/test users there. 
But, this sucks. MS decided to install the client in appdata, so centrally
updating all users on a PC is, well, potentially a mess. I "love" when the
client is uninstalled (from appdata), tries to install the new one, but the user
lacks permissions and finishes with no MS Teams installed on his profile. 
Best regards 
Seve 
Von: 'Amag' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Gesendet: Montag, 15. Januar 2024 00:39
An: PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Betreff: [patchmanagement] Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams 
-!-!-!- EXTERNAL EMAIL -!-!-!- This email originated from outside of SKAN. Do
not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the
content is safe 
Hi 
MS announced that Classic Teams users will be updated to new Teams after March
2024, but looks like MS are pushing early as some of our users had the "forced"
screen recently and looking at other forums a few others have been forced over
too over the last month. Some of our users (including myself) who have had the
update have seen a number of bugs in the new version Teams. We have had to
switch back to classic due to crashing issues and the concern is this may become
a wider issue to our end-user community as Teams is not managed as part of the
M365 update but rather "MS controlled" through Teams Admin with limited
options. 
I'm wondering if anyone else has seen this issue and how have you addressed it
within your org? Did you send any comms to end-users to notify them of the new
update and the option to switch back to classic if they experience any issues? 
Not even sure why MS couldn't allow IT admins the ability to deploy Teams
updates through any delivery mechanism in the same way for M365 apps! 
Thanks, 
Amag 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/DBBP189MB1340EBD048E8A6FAD37AE527E96C2%40DBBP189MB1340.EURP189.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM
